page.title: 06LEITH ALLOTMENTS
page.content: { LEITH ALLOTTMENTS { Leith Links allottments were first opened in world war 2 in 1940. After the war they were closed but re_ opened in 1963 on the 5th September There are 28 allotments. Each person is alloted 36 square yards for growing their vegetables.There is an annual rent which is paid to the local council. This rent is about is about 8 Pounds a year. A few years ago the rent was put up to 28 Pounds annually but then the council put it back to 8 Pounds. There is a special rent of 2 Pounds for old age pensioners.
